articles.title: Whole Milk May Be Better When It Comes to Children’s Weight
articles.description: Kids who drank whole milk were at a 39 percent reduced risk for being overweight than those who drank low-fat milk.
articles.content:
Whole milk may be healthier for childrens weight than low-fat milk, a review of studies suggests.
The American Academy of Pediatrics currently recommends switching to skim or low-fat (1 percent) milk at age 2.

articles.title: A Near-Extinct Language Finds a Home in One Brooklyn Building
articles.description: There are just 700 Seke speakers left in the world, and 100 live in New York — half of them in one building.
articles.content:
Another language, Wakhi, from eastern Iran as well as parts of Pakistan, China, Tajikistan and Afghanistan, is believed to be spoken by just one person in New York, according to the language alliance.
